text: First Minister Humza Yousaf tells the BBC, with his voice breaking, about a phone call from his mother-in-law who is stuck in Gaza.Elizabeth El-Nakla and her husband, Maged, had travelled to the south of the Palestinian enclave last week to see a sick relative.Mr Yousaf said he received a panicked call from her at 01:00 when neighbours believed there was going to be an imminent strike - which turned out to be a false alarm.He reiterated his calls for humanitarian aid to be allowed into the region and for a ceasefire.© 2023 BBC.
